title: I'm going to die if I don't get a job soon.
self_text: This is the first time I've ever been so broke in my life, and I just need some help. I have been looking for jobs for about a month now, but it's just not working out. Every place I go, they say that I'm overqualified or not experienced enough.  I used to work at an ABC store with a great team and environment. We had many customers come into the store every day and we made a lot of money. But eventually the owner was like "Hey, you guys are doing great, let's cut your hours" and then he closed down the store due to financial issues.  Then after that, I got fired from my previous workplace because of COVID-19. Now, I'm trying to get back on my feet by finding a new job, but it's hard when no one will hire me.  I know I'm not the best candidate, but I'm willing to learn and give my all to any company that hires me.  I can also take on extra responsibilities if needed.  Can anyone point me to resources or advice?  Thank you!

title: AITA for saying I can't work on the weekends?

I would be happy to work on the weekend occasionally, but I'm trying to establish some sort of routine so that my weekdays aren't so exhausting. They keep telling me I need to prioritize my health, but that just makes them think I'm being lazy.  TLDR; I said I couldn't do something on the weekend, and now everyone thinks I'm being difficult. AITA for not wanting to work on the weekend when others seem to want to do that?

I know that it takes a lot of time and dedication to master these pieces, but I'm starting to feel like I won't be able to do it. title: I have a dream, let me google that for you
self_text: I’ve been told to “google it” whenever I ask a question that is considered common knowledge, and I find it annoying when I ask something that should be in everyone’s mind, and they say to Google it.  I don’t know why people do this. Why would you make someone feel stupid?   It makes me think about how the internet has changed our society. We used to be able to learn from each other, but now we just rely on Google. It’s like we’re losing our ability to think for ourselves. I miss the days when I could just ask someone a question and they would answer me. Now, everyone just says to Google it.

I'd like to hear your advice from people who have done this before. Thank you!

title: Why do we always say that?
self_text: I've heard this phrase since I was a kid, and now it's everywhere - "That's the way the cookie crumbles." It's used for every little thing. When something goes wrong or when someone is upset with you, they will say "that's the way the cookie crumbles" to try to make you feel better.

title: Is it okay to say that a team is "good" if they have a high win rate, or does the definition of good depend on how many teams are in the league?
self_text: I was watching some basketball games last night and I heard people say a team is “good” because they have a high win rate.  I’m not sure what that means though… does “good” mean something different depending on how many teams there are? If there are only ten teams in a league, then winning 10 games out of 30 would be pretty good. But if there were 20 teams, 10 wins out of 60 would be more like average.   So do you think the win rate needs to be considered in terms of the number of teams in the league when trying to define whether a team is “good”?

title: Why do I feel so bad when I fail a test?
self_text: It's just that the feeling of failing is too strong for me, and it makes me think about all the time I wasted studying and not getting anywhere, and then I end up having to redo everything again. I don't even know what I did wrong because I was trying my best but still failed, and now I just have a huge amount of pressure on me to study harder next time.   I've tried talking to friends and family about it, but they just tell me "everyone fails tests sometimes" or "don't be so hard on yourself", which doesn't really help much because I know I need to change something about how I approach learning and testing. I want to understand why I am constantly disappointed in myself when things don't go as planned, and I want to find a way to move past it without letting it affect my motivation.   Does anyone else experience similar feelings? Do you have any advice for coping with the disappointment of failing a test and regaining your confidence in your abilities?

I know it's difficult, but I am willing to put in the time and research needed to make sure everything is compatible. Any suggestions on parts or how to approach building a gaming PC with limited resources?

title: No more coding in the office?
self_text: I had to leave my job at a large company and move to the outskirts of town where I work from home. It's been 6 months now, and the only thing that has really changed is that I don't have to deal with any coworkers anymore. I was told by my manager on my last day that he didn't want me to continue visiting his office. He said it was because he felt like I was always bothering him, even when I was just there to drop off a file or ask a quick question. He said it was becoming too much for him to handle. So here I am, working from home, with no coworkers, no distractions, and no pressure to perform. It's peaceful, quiet, and productive. But something feels missing. Like I'm not fully living my life.  I used to love going into the office every day, meeting new people, and having the energy of a busy workplace around me. Now, I just feel lonely. I miss the social interaction, the camaraderie, and the sense of belonging. I miss being part of a team, collaborating on projects, and feeling like I was contributing to something bigger than myself. But most of all, I miss talking to people.  I know that working from home isn't for everyone. Some people thrive in a busy, collaborative environment, while others need the structure and support of a traditional office setting. And I get that. I respect that. But for me, this new way of working isn't bringing me happiness. It's just making me feel empty.  I know that I need to find a way to fill this void in my life. I need to find something that will give me purpose, passion, and connection. I need to find something that will make me feel like I'm truly alive.  But I don't know what that is yet.  Maybe I should try joining a club, volunteering for a cause, or taking up a new hobby. Or maybe I should just spend more time alone, reflecting on my life and figuring out what I really want. Whatever I decide to do, I know that I need to be proactive about finding something that will bring me joy and fulfillment. I can't just sit here and wait for things to change. I have to take control of my own destiny. I have to create my own happiness. I have to be the architect of my own life.  And if that means leaving this job and starting over somewhere else, then so be it.  Because right now, all I can think about is how much I miss the days when I could walk into an office and be surrounded by people.  It wasn't always easy, but it was good. It was real. And I don't want to lose that feeling again.  So, what do you guys think? How can I combat the loneliness and emptiness that I'm feeling? Do you have any advice for me?  Thank you for listening.

title: Jackson Chourio named MLB Pipeline’s No. 1 prospect ahead of 2023 draft
self_text: Here's my take on the 2023 MLB Draft, with a look at some of the top prospects and where I think teams will be targeting them. This is based on what I've seen in games and from conversations with scouts and other baseball people around town.   **Top 5 Prospects (in no particular order):** 1.  Jackson Chourio (SS) - The hype for Jackson Chourio has been building over the past year or so due to his ability to hit the ball hard, as well as his speed and athleticism. He's got all the tools to be an everyday player, but he still needs to work on his defense and plate discipline. But for now, he's the best prospect in the draft. 2.  Colton Loveland (RHP) - Colton Loveland is a highly regarded pitcher who comes into the draft with the potential to be a big league starter. He has a great fastball, a good curveball, and a changeup that he can use effectively. He's also very intelligent on the mound, which allows him to make adjustments during games. 3.  Blake Clarkson (RHP) - Blake Clarkson is a strong, athletic pitcher with a great arsenal of pitches. He has a fastball that can touch the mid-90s, a slider that breaks down at the bottom of the zone, and a changeup that gets the hitter off balance.  4.  Junior Fernandez (LHP) - Junior Fernandez is another highly regarded left-handed pitcher coming out of the draft. He's got a quick arm, good command, and a high floor. His stuff isn't overpowering, but he's able to get hitters out with his movement and deception. 5.  Wyatt Langford (OF) - Wyatt Langford is a physical outfielder with a ton of power potential. He's still going to need to improve his contact rate and defensive skills, but if he does, he could easily become one of the biggest offensive stars in baseball.   **Other Notable Prospects:** 6.  Evan Fort (SP) - Evan Fort is a young pitcher who has quickly developed into one of the most exciting prospects in baseball. He has a great fastball, a good curveball, and a changeup that he can use effectively.  7.  Cody Miller (RHP) - Cody Miller is a highly regarded right-handed pitcher who comes into the draft with the potential to be a big league starter. He has a great fastball, a good curveball, and a changeup that he can use effectively.  8.  Trey Hunter (OF) - Trey Hunter is a speedy outfielder who can steal bases and score runs. He's not the strongest hitter, but he has the potential to develop into a solid offensive contributor. 9.  Koleman Machanic (2B) - Koleman Machanic is a gritty second baseman with a strong arm and good instincts.  10. Jaden Hull (RHP) - Jaden Hull is a young right-handed pitcher who has a lot of upside. He has a great fastball, a good curveball, and a changeup that he can use effectively.   **Teams Targeting:** * **Dodgers:** Looking to bolster their offense, the Dodgers are expected to target players like Jackson Chourio, Wyatt Langford, and Evan Fort.  * **Yankees:**  The Yankees have a lot of needs after losing Aaron Judge, Gerrit Cole, and several other key players. They're expected to target players like Colton Loveland, Jaden Hull, and Cody Miller.  * **Red Sox:**  The Red Sox are looking to rebuild their farm system, so they're expected to target players like Junior Fernandez, Trey Hunter, and Koleman Machanic.  * **Mets:**  The Mets are looking to add more pitching depth, so they're expected to target players like Jackson Chourio, Colton Loveland, and Evan Fort.   I hope this preview helps! Let me know if you have any questions.

title: I need to sell my guitar
self_text: I am selling my taylor 314ce, 2018 for $1650 usd. I’m open to trades and reasonable offers. The guitar is in excellent condition, no dings or scratches.  I have the original case, cable, and picks included.  This is a great guitar for beginners and intermediate players alike. It sounds fantastic live as well! Here are some details about the guitar: Brand: Taylor Model: 314CE Year: 2018 Case: Original Taylor case Electronics: Fishman Sonitone system String spacing: 14/97 scale length: 25.5" Nut width: 1 3/4" Action: 2 1/16" on high E string, 2 1/16" on low E string   I'd prefer local pickup but will ship if you want it. No international shipping. I can be reached at (XXX) XXX-XXXX or via pm. Please note that I do not check messages frequently so please leave your phone number.

title: AITA for saying that my mom needs to stop making money?
self_text: My mom works a minimum wage job at a grocery store, and she just quit her job to stay home with me and my sibling(s) because I'm "getting too big" for the house. She says she can't afford to work any more and wants to be a full time parent now. My sibling(s) are still in school, so it's not like they need her all day long. I think she's making a huge mistake by quitting her job, as there are plenty of other people who would love to have the job she had. Also, she has a degree! Why is she working at a grocery store when she could be doing something else? It just doesn't make sense to me.  I don't want her to lose her identity or feel useless, but I also don't want her to throw away her life savings. Am I being selfish?  To answer your question, yes. But why am I being selfish? You'll find out in the next paragraph.

self_text: I am 26 years old, single mom of two, and just got laid off from my retail job. I have been trying to find another job for the past month but I keep getting rejected. The reason they give me is that I lack experience. This is hard when I used to work there and was one of the top sellers. But now, it's different. My last manager left, and the new manager hates me. She keeps saying that I need to learn how to use the POS system better. It's like she wants me fired. I don't know what to do anymore. I am so stressed out about money and I don't know where to turn. I need to find a job ASAP because my savings are running low.

I really enjoy helping people learn new things and it's rewarding to see students progress. However, I want to make more money and have a stable career. I am not sure what I want to do but I know that I want something related to technology. I have some programming skills but I need to improve them significantly.

title: I just found out that my uncle is a former U.S. Army Sergeant who served in the Vietnam War and was awarded the Purple Heart for his valor during the Battle of Ia Drang.  I'm proud to be an American but also ashamed that our country used so many young men as human shields.   I have some questions I need to ask him when we next meet.  Can anyone provide me with a list of questions to ask or other resources on how to learn more about his experiences? Thank you.
self_text: It's okay to be angry, but don't let it turn into hate.  We should honor these people and their sacrifice by learning more about the war they fought in.  The US military isn't responsible for what happened in the vietnam war, and the way the US treated the vietnamese people during the war wasn't good either. I am just trying to understand why he went to such lengths to fight.  Maybe there was something specific about the war that made him want to serve, or maybe he had family members who served before him.  It could even have been because he felt like he needed to prove himself.  But whatever the reason, I think it's important to respect his decision to go to war and to recognize the sacrifices he made.

title: I’m trying to find the origin of the term “godzilla”
self_text: In 1954, a Japanese film called Godzilla was released and became an international phenomenon. However, it was not named after a mythological beast that has existed since antiquity. Instead, the name comes from a German word.  Specifically, the name “Godzilla” is derived from the German word “Gottzilla”, which literally translates to “Godzilla.” The director of the film, Ishiro Honda, used the name because he wanted to emphasize the character's role as a symbol of God.  The movie was initially released in Japan under the title “Mothra vs. Godzilla”. It’s been said that the original intention was to have Godzilla fight Mothra, but instead they had Mothra come to the rescue when Godzilla destroyed Tokyo.   In the English version of the film, the title was changed to “Godzilla”. However, there’s a bit of controversy surrounding this change. Some people say that the title “Godzilla” was chosen by the studio executives to make the film sound more threatening and scary. Others say that the title was chosen to honor the Christian concept of God. Whatever the reason, the title “Godzilla” stuck around for the rest of the film series. In fact, it’s become synonymous with the monster himself.

title: Why is the sky blue?
self_text: When sunlight enters Earth’s atmosphere, it is scattered in all directions by air molecules.  This scattering is more intense for shorter wavelengths of light (blue and violet) than for longer wavelengths (red and yellow). The reason we see a blue sky instead of a purple one is because there is less violet light in sunlight to begin with and our eyes are not as sensitive to violet as they are to blue.  As the sun sets or rises, sunlight has to travel through more of the atmosphere to reach our eyes. This causes more of the blue light to scatter away from our line of sight. As a result, the remaining light that reaches us is rich in red and orange wavelengths.

I have been doing cardio for about 3 weeks now (about 45 mins, 4 times a week) and have also been eating roughly 1800 calories/day mostly from plants. I'm not sure if it's working because I still don't see any results. I was hoping to get some advice or help from anyone that has been through something similar.

title: [Announcement] New Game Announcement
self_text: Hey everyone, I'm here to announce the next game coming from our studio! We’ve been working hard on it for years and are so excited to finally share it with you all. We know many of you have been waiting a long time and we appreciate your patience. The full announcement will be released soon, but wanted to give you a sneak peek now. The game is called “The Celestial Echoes” and has a bit of everything in it. It’s an open world action RPG set on a vibrant planet filled with ancient ruins, dangerous monsters, and valuable treasures. You can explore the vast landscapes at your own pace, battle enemies, complete quests, collect loot, and build up your character.  You will play as a lone traveler who has lost his way through the portal and finds himself in this strange new world. There’s no story or goal set by the developers, you just want to survive out there.   There will be many things that can make you die like giant monsters, environmental hazards, and other players. But if you do survive, there are many rewards for surviving. Here are some features that we think will be fun: - Open World: Explore beautiful planets filled with diverse biomes, including forests, deserts, mountains, and oceans. - Character Progression: Customize your character’s skills and abilities using a deep system. - Combat: Battle hordes of enemies using a variety of weapons and spells. - Crafting: Create powerful items and equipment. - Multiplayer: Team up with friends and other players to take on challenging dungeons and raids. We really hope you enjoy what we’ve created and look forward to hearing your feedback. Stay tuned for more updates!  We’ll release the official trailer on December 23rd and the game itself will be available for purchase on January 27th. Thank you for your support.  We love you guys!  - Our team at Crimson Skies Studios

title: Why does the end of Harry Potter look so rushed?
self_text: I’ve rewatched the final three movies and I just feel like they were super rushed. There was not enough time to develop character arcs, plot points or even explore all the magical implications of the wizarding world ending. For example, in the last movie, it feels like Harry is just waiting for Voldemort to die so he can go back to his normal life.  I think if we had a few more scenes, we could have explored how Harry felt about what happened with Dumbledore and the prophecy. We also did not get to see much about how the wizarding world would deal with the aftermath of the war.   I know that the books ended after seven volumes but they still left me feeling like there was a lot more to tell.

title: Why is it that people who love to say they are over their ex always have the worst taste in guys?
self_text: I swear, the guy she's dating now is exactly like her ex - just a different package. They both act entitled and demanding when it comes to time, attention, and affection from others.  They both have a tendency to be overly critical and judgmental of everyone around them.   The only difference is that he has a job (not that she doesn't). It's like she's looking for someone to mirror what she had with her ex, but can't see how that's going to end badly.  And all of these guys are just as bad as her ex...just in a different form. I am so sick of seeing people treat each other like this.
